intro: Lupinus albus var. termis, commonly known as the Termis white lupin, is a variety of the white lupin native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial plant characterized by its upright growth habit and compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets. The flowers are typically white or pale purple, arranged in dense, spikelike clusters. This plant thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for cultivation in Mediterranean climates. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and historical use in traditional herbal medicine.
